pr_title: [JENKINS-63276] Make empty installed plugins text readable

timeline.message: Make empty installed plugins text readable

timeline.bodyText:
shouldn't this just be a regular cell?
the dark background looks quite weird in the screenshot?
i.e. skip the header and just make it a td?
timeline.author: timja
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -68,9 +68,9 @@ THE SOFTWARE.
       <table id="plugins" class="pane bigtable sortable stripped-odd">
         <j:choose>
           <j:when test="${empty(app.pluginManager.plugins) and empty(app.pluginManager.failedPlugins)}">
-            <tr><td>
+            <tr><th>

replies.bodyText: I had the same thought, this should probably look similar to the placeholder text on the revised "Available" tab.
replies.author: daniel-beck

replies.bodyText:
The problem is that the first table row will look like a header. So then either we remove that message from the table or we do something like

WDYT?
replies.author: fqueiruga

replies.bodyText: @fqueiruga What's wrong with keeping the real table header and having a placeholder item with the message? Would that be confusing?
replies.author: daniel-beck

replies.bodyText: Nothing, it's what I changed. I just didn't do it at the beginning because it didn't occur to me.
replies.author: fqueiruga

replies.bodyText: Ah, with real table header you mean with the proper fields like name, version, etc? We would need to then add a colspan attribute and it looks messy: ${%No plugins installed.}
replies.author: fqueiruga

replies.bodyText:
Yes, doesn't seem like it needs a special header unless that makes it clearer what's going on.
Very minor comment, the current state is already good 👍
replies.author: daniel-beck

replies.bodyText: See my edit with what the code would look like
replies.author: fqueiruga
